revision.text:
'''Taistelupetankki''' ([[Finnish language|Finnish]] for "combat pétanque") is an outdoor sport game based on [[pétanque]], developed in [[Finland]] in 1999. Taistelupetankki is played with the same equipment as pétanque, but it can be played in more diverse terrain.
In the game, a player (or a team) has two metal balls. On his/her turn, the player tries to get at least one of his/her balls closest to the jack. There are two ways to get one's ball closest to the jack: try to throw one's ball close enough in the first place, or try to knock an opponent's ball or the jack off with one's own ball. A popular tactic is to use one ball to knock an opponent's ball off and the other to get closest to the jack. If a player doesn't get even one of his balls closest to the jack on his/her turn, he/she drops out of the game. The game continues until only one player remains.
Taistelupetankki players describe the game as "continuing where pétanque left off".
==Equipment== * Two iron balls, discernible from others. Diameter 60 to 80 mm, weight 600 to 800 g. * Jack, usually made of wood. Diameter 20 to 40 mm.
==Course of the game== One of the players, usually the winner of the last game or the youngest player, throws the jack to a place he/she deems worthy. After this, a combination shot happens, where every player throws both of their balls, one at a time, onto the playing field, every player at the same time. It is recommended to watch where the balls land.
The first proper throwing round is started by the player who has either of his/her balls the furthest away from the jack. Both balls are thrown, one at a time, towards the jack so that at least one of them ends up closest to the jack. If the player fails to do this on his/her turn, he/she drops out of the game.
The next throwing turn is for the player who has either of his/her balls the furthest away from the jack. This continues until all players have thrown their balls, and this order of throwing continues for the following rounds.
===The throw=== The player picks his/her ball up from the ground from between his/her feet and throws it where he/she stands. Contrary to normal pétanque, it is allowed to jump during the throw, provided that the player lands on the same spot where he/she started from. The ball must travel in the air at least 10 cm.
===Duration=== The game can last from five minutes to an hour, depending on the circumstances (skill, terrain conditions, weather, number of successful knocks, the players' mental state...)
===Judges=== The players act as judges themselves, in order to reach a [[consensus]] should controversial situations arise.
==Competitions== The Finnish Taistelupetankki Association holds competitions open to everyone. There are competitions all year round, mostly based on the [[Helsinki metropolitan area|capital region]]. Also individual competitions are held annually at least in [[Tampere]] and [[Tallinn]].
==External links== * [http://www.taistelupetankki.fi/tp/ Taistelupetankkiliitto]

{{Infobox stadium | stadium_name = Toroslar Bocce Facility
Toroslar Bocce Tesisi | image = | location = [[Toroslar]], [[Mersin]], [[Turkey]] |coordinates = {{coord|36|51|00|N|34|37|32|E|type:landmark_scale:100000|display=inline,title}} | broke_ground = | opened = {{start date and age|2013}} | owner = Youth Services and Sports Directoriate of Mersin | operator = | construction_cost = | former_names = | tenants = Toroslar Belediyespor bocce team | seating_capacity = 1,000 |Official_website = }} The '''Toroslar Bocce Facility''' ({{lang-tr|Toroslar Bocce Tesisi}}) is a 16-court [[indoor arena|indoor sports venue]] for [[bocce]] events at [[Toroslar]] district in [[Mersin]], [[Turkey]]. Built for use by the [[Bocce at the 2013 Mediterranean Games|2013 Mediterranean Games]] and opened in 2013, it is owned by the Youth Services and Sports Directoriate of Mersin having a seating capacity of 1,000.{{cite web |url=http://www.mersin2013.gov.tr/detay/6703/Bocce-Tesisi |publisher=Mersin 2013 |title=1.000 Seyirci Kapasiteli Bocce Tesisi |language=Turkish |accessdate=2013-07-08 }}{{cite news |url=http://www.memurlar.net/haber/348466/ |newspaper=Memurlar |title=Toroslar’da 2013 Akdeniz Oyunları için protokol imzalandı |date=2013-03-08 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2013-07-08 }} The facility is home to Toroslar Belediyespor bocce team.{{cite news |url=http://www.sondakika.com/haber/haber-toroslar-belediyesi-bocce-turnuvasinda-birinci-4437974/ |newspaper=Son Dakika |title=Toroslar Belediyesi Bocce Turnuvasında Birinci Oldu |date=2013-03-18 |language=Turkish|accessdate=2013-07-08 }}{{cite news |url=http://www.sondakika.com/haber/haber-bocce-mersin-sampiyonasi-sona-erdi-4657698/ |newspaper=Son Dakika |title=Bocce Mersin Şampiyonası Sona Erdi |date=2013-05-22 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2013-07-08 }} Bocce competitions of the 2013 Mediterranean Games were hosted in the venue on June 25–29.{{cite web |url=http://2013akdenizolimpiyat.com/index.php/tesisler.html |publisher=Akdeniz Olimpiyat |title=2013 Akdeniz Oyunlarının Oynanacağı Tesisler-Bocce Tesisi |language=Turkish |accessdate=2013-07-08 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.tbbdf.gov.tr/boccede-tarihi-altin |publisher=Türkiye Bocce, Bowling ve Dart Federasyonu |title=Bocce'de Tarihi Altın |language=Turkish |accessdate=2013-07-05 }} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Venues of the 2013 Mediterranean Games}} {{Mersin Province}} [[Category:Indoor arenas in Turkey]] [[Category:Sports venues in Mersin]] [[Category:Toroslar District]] [[Category:Sports venues completed in 2013]] [[Category:2013 Mediterranean Games venues]] {{Turkey-sports-venue-stub}}

{{redirects here|Mindanao Aguilas|the basketball team initially named Mindanao Aguilas|Pilipinas MX3 Kings}} {{Infobox basketball club |color1=white |color2=#F11D11 |color3=black |name=ZC Mindanao Aguilas |logo=Mindanao Aguilas logo.png |leagues=[[PBA Developmental League|PBA D-League]] (2016) |founded=2015 |history='''Z.C. Mindanao Aguilas'''
2015-present |arena= |location=[[Philippines]] |nickname= |colors={{Color box|red}} {{Color box|black}} {{Color box|white}} ||coach=Jade Marvin Padrigao |president= |championships= |website= |h_pattern_b=|h_body=FF0000|h_shorts=FF0000|h_pattern_s= |a_pattern_b=|a_body=|a_shorts=|a_pattern_s= }} The '''ZC Mindanao Aguilas''' is a [[basketball]] team playing in the [[PBA Developmental League]]. The team primarily focuses on giving exposure to [[Mindanao]]-based players who receive less attention than their Metro Manila counterparts.{{cite news|last1=Lozada|first1=Bong|title=PBA D-League: Aguilas provide chance for Mindanao-based players to shiner|url=http://pba.inquirer.net/66345/pba-d-league-aguilas-want-to-give-more-opportunities-to-mindanao-based-players|accessdate=16 February 2016|publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=21 January 2016}}{{cite web|last1=Li|first1=Matthew|title=Mindanao Aguilas: More than just a team|url=http://tiebreakertimes.com/tbt/mindanao-aguilas-just-team/46972|website=Tiebreaker Times|accessdate=16 May 2016|date=24 January 2016}} The team made their debut at the [[2016 PBA D-League Aspirant's Cup]].{{cite news|last1=Jurado|first1=Theodore|title=Aguilas make debut|url=http://www.journal.com.ph/sports/basketball/aguilas-make-debut|accessdate=16 February 2016|work=Journal Online|date=22 January 2016}} and earned their first win against BDO-[[National University Bulldogs|NU Bulldogs]]. The team is managed by Kings Janitorial Services and Cooperative of Zamboanga, and is an affiliated team of [[GlobalPort Batang Pier]] in the [[Philippine Basketball League]]. Prior to joining the Aspirant's Cup, the team has been preparing for two months for their PBA D-League stint. They won a local tournament in Zamboanga and participated at the Del League in [[Marikina]]. They also arranged tune games against Phoenix Petroleum and BDO. They lost both games.{{cite news|last1=Servinio|first1=Anthony|title=Watch Out For The Aguilas|url=https://servssports.wordpress.com/2016/01/20/watch-out-for-the-aguilas/|accessdate=16 May 2016|publisher=Servinio's Sports Etc.|date=20 January 2016}} ==Coaching Staff & Players== ===Coaching Staff=== Team Owners * Roderick Andong * Antonio Chiong * Junnie Navarro Team Manager * Sergei Bien Orillo Team Consultant * Louie Medalla Head Coach * Nino Rejhi Natividad Assistant Coaches: * Jade Marvin Padrigao (1st Asst.) * Nadz Burung * Peter Delegero ===Current Roster=== 2016 Aspirants Cup * 3 [[Jul-Ashri Ignacio]] 26, 6′-1″ * 24 [[Gino Jumao-As]] 23, 6′-2″ * 27 [[Taylor Wetherell]] 25, 6′-0″ * 25 [[Dexter Garcia]] 26, 5′-11″ * 9 [[Jaynard Rivera]] 25, 6′-4″ * 19 Jericho de Guzman 26, 6′-11″ * 8 [[Ar-Rouf Julkipli]] 25, 5′-9″ * 23 [[Ivan Villanueva]] 20, 6′-2″ * 18 [[Kenneth Acibar]] 26, 6′-4″ * 10 [[Joseph Nalos]] 23, 5′-8″ * 14 [[Rolando Navarro Jr.]] 29, 5′-8″ * 6 [[Mark Sarangay]] 29, 6′-5″ * 13 [[JR Ongteco]] 26, 6′-5″ * 88 [[Grevanni Rublico]] 25, 5′-11″ ===Former Players=== * # [[Marc Barroca]] * # [[RR Garcia]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{PBA Developmental League}} [[Category:PBA Developmental League teams]] {{Philippines-basketball-team-stub}}
